Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In

the area manager Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Title & requirements; staff qualifications
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was placed at the facility as a minor from 3/19/24-5/22/24.
Youth had a relationship with a staff member who is now
pregnant.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
An attempt was made to interview the Complainant via phone
on 12/11/24 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Complainant
was did not provide their extension and could not be directly
connected with, without an extension number. Complainant was
unable to be interviewed.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via phone on 12/17/24 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 2 reported Staff 9
informed her she heard Youth A was going to be a father, and the
mother of the child was possibly a staff who previously worked at
Casa Del Sol. Supervisor 2 reported she wasn’t told the name of
the former staff and is not aware of when their alleged relationship
began.
Staff 9 was interviewed via phone on 12/17/24 in coordination
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 9 reported her fiancé, Staff 10, works
at CCI Bridgeway and told her Youth A impregnated a woman
who previously worked at Casa Del Sol. Staff 9 reported she
wasn’t told the name of the former staff member. Staff 9 reported
she is not aware if Youth A and the former staff member were in a
relationship while Youth A lived at the facility.
Youth A was interviewed face to face in a community parking
lot on 12/13/24 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported no staff ever said or did anything inappropriate to him
while he was placed at the facility. Youth A reported he had not
spoken with Staff 1 since leaving the facility in May 2024. Youth A
reported while he was at the facility, Staff 1 gave him a ride to the
mall to see friends one time and she also transported him to play
soccer a few times, but these transports were done during Staff
1’s working hours. Youth A reported he did not live with Staff 1,
never had sex with Staff 1, and never talked to her on the phone
while he was at the facility or after he left the facility.
2

MDHHS Worker was interviewed via phone on 12/13/24.
MDHHS Worker reported Youth A called her back a few hours
after his initial interview and changed his story. Youth A told
MDHHS Worker he was at Casa Del Sol for 2 months and left the
facility in May 2024 after he turned 18. Youth A reported while he
was at the facility, he didn’t have much contact with Staff 1 or get
to know Staff 1 much because he wasn’t there for long, and Staff
1 only worked on the weekends. Youth A reported when he left
the facility, he was renting a room from someone. Youth A
reported in July 2024, he was told he had to find a new place to
live. Youth A reported he remembered one time he was talking to
Staff 1 when she was working at the facility, and said she was
going to need a roommate this summer. Youth A reported he
searched for Staff 1’s phone number and wouldn’t provide further
details regarding this, and got into contact with her. Youth A
learned Staff 1 was no longer working at the facility because she
wanted to spend time with her son. Youth A reported he asked
Staff 1 if he could rent a room from her, and she agreed, so he
began renting a room in Staff 1’s apartment in July or August
2024. Youth A reported he and Staff 1 were only roommates until
September or October 2024, but then they began a relationship.
Youth A denied there was any relationship between him and Staff
1 when Staff 1 worked at the facility. Youth A reported he only
“hung out” with Staff 1 at the facility when Staff 1 took him to the
mall to spend time with friends, or when they went to the park as a
group outing.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at a community library on
12/18/24 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported
she quit working at the facility in May or June 2024 because she
brought her son to the USA and wanted to spend time with him.
Staff 1 reported beginning in March 2024 she was working two
jobs, but she took a lot of time off due to her son arriving in the
USA, helping him to adjust. Staff 1 reported she met Youth A
when he was a youth at the facility, and he was 17 at the time.
Staff 1 reported when she and Youth A were at the facility, they
weren’t that close as he was new, and she only worked on the
weekends. Staff 1 reported when Youth A was at the facility, she
took Youth A to the mall on an outing one time, but they didn’t talk
much because he was new. Staff 1 reported any other outings she
took him on were group outings with other youth to the movie
theater, park, or to play soccer. Staff 1 reported Youth A moved
out of the facility when he was 18, and the next time she spoke to
him was in July 2024. Staff 1 reported Youth A texted her, asked
how she was doing, asked how her son was, and she told Youth A
she wasn’t working at the facility any longer. Staff 1 reported
3

Youth A told her he needed a place to stay and asked if she had
an extra room to rent. Staff 1 reported she was struggling with
bills, and had a 2-bedroom apartment, so she decided to share a
room with her son and rent out the other room to Youth A for $500
per month. Staff 1 reported Youth A still lives with her, and they
began a relationship between August-October 2024. Staff 1
reported while she worked at the facility and Youth A resided in
the facility, they never exchanged text messages, phone calls,
pictures, inappropriate interactions, sexual favors, etc. Staff 1
reported she is not pregnant. Staff 1 reported she went through
boundary training every year she worked at the facility (since
2021) and is aware what constitutes an appropriate interaction
and relationship with a youth. Staff 1 reported she knew what the
consequences would be if boundaries were crossed, and she
never crossed any boundaries with any youth while working at the
facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
12/18/24 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported he is not aware of any youth and staff having
inappropriate relationships currently or in the past. Youth B
reported he remembered Youth A and Staff 1. Youth B reported
Youth A never talked to him about Staff 1, and he isn’t aware of
Youth A and Staff 1 communicating outside of the facility. Youth B
reported he is not aware of Staff 1 ever sending pictures to any
youth via text.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
12/18/24 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth C
reported he is not aware of any staff having any inappropriate
relationships or communication with youth currently or in the past.
Youth C reported he only knew Youth A for approximately 2
weeks before Youth A left the facility, so he didn’t know him well.
Youth C reported he remembered Staff 1 and does not remember
her doing anything she shouldn’t have been doing.
Youth D was interviewed via phone on 1/6/25 in coordination
with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported he had a lot of
communication with Staff 1 while he was at the facility, and she
was working there. Youth D reported Staff 1 did not have any
inappropriate verbal, sexual, or physical interactions with him or
any other youth at the facility that he is aware of. Youth D reported
there were a lot of youth who didn’t like Staff 1 because she was
from Guatemala. Youth D reported there were some youths, like
Youth E, who were attracted to Staff 1 and made advances
towards her, but Staff 1 reported them and the youth got in trouble
4

for their actions towards her. Youth D reported he always saw
Staff 1 following the rules and doing the right thing, and he didn’t
have any concerns about her. Youth D reported he went on
individual and group outings with Staff 1. Youth D reported outings
didn’t have a specific timeframe, but they were supposed to return
to the facility by 8 pm. Youth D reported the only times Staff 1
brought them back after 8 pm was because of traffic, or if they lost
track of time while hanging out at the park because they enjoyed
being outside during the summer. Youth D reported most staff
didn’t want to take youth on outings for long periods of time, but
Staff 1 was willing to because she only worked on weekends and
weekends weren’t as busy with school, appointments, etc.
Youth E was interviewed via phone on 1/6/25 in coordination
with MDHHS Worker. Youth E reported Staff 1 was never
inappropriate with him and he is not aware of Staff 1 having any
inappropriate interactions or relationships with any youth. Youth E
reported he never witnessed Staff 1 acting inappropriately with
Youth A. Youth E reported Staff 1 acted the same with all youth
she interacted with, and didn’t treat anyone differently. Youth E
reported typically Staff 1 took him and other youth on group
outings for approximately 1-3 hours, but sometimes they had all
day outings if they were going to the park or the beach on nice
days.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/18/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported he is not
aware of any inappropriate relationships between staff and youth,
but he has heard suspicions. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 told him he
saw a picture of Staff 1 and Youth A that Staff 1 posted on her
social media page after Staff 1 and Youth A left the facility. Staff 2
reported Staff 3 also told him he saw Staff 1 and Youth A were at
a store together last week. Staff 2 reported he is not aware of
Youth A and Staff 1 having any inappropriate interactions when
they were at the facility.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/18/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he is
aware Youth A and Staff 1 are in a relationship because he saw
them at a store together last week. Staff 3 reported he also saw a
picture Staff 1 posted on her social media a few months ago of her
and Youth A. Staff 3 reported he is not aware when they began
their relationship, and he did not notice them having any
inappropriate interactions while they were at the facility. Staff 3
reported he had concerns about Staff 1’s performance when she
worked at the facility because she would frequently take youth,
5

including Youth A, on long outings (gone for approximately 6+
hours, and sometimes past the 8 pm curfew). Staff 3 reported
Staff 1 only worked on the weekends and frequently worked 12-
hour shifts. Staff 3 reported it was common Staff 1 wasn’t at the
facility often during her shift, and it was noticed Youth A was also
gone frequently during the time Staff 1 was. Staff 3 reported one
time he asked Staff 1 where she went, and she held her finger up
to her mouth and said, “shhhh”.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/18/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported she is not
aware of any inappropriate relationships between staff and youth
currently or in the past. Staff 4 reported she never had any
concerns about Staff 1 being inappropriate with any youth. Staff 4
reported Staff 1 used to be more engaged with the Hispanic youth
who were from Guatemala because she was from Guatemala as
well, but she was nice to all the youth. Staff 4 reported she never
noticed any odd or inappropriate actions between Staff 1 and
Youth A.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/18/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported he is not
aware of any inappropriate relationships between staff and youth,
currently or in the past. Staff 5 reported he never saw Staff 1 and
Youth A interact inappropriately. Staff 5 reported working with
Staff 1 was difficult because during her shift, she would frequently
be on outings with youth, sometimes in groups, but sometimes
individually with Youth A.
Staff 6 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/18/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 6 reported she is not
aware of any inappropriate relationships between youth and staff
currently or in the past. Staff 6 reported when Staff 1 worked at
the facility, she would frequently take Youth A, Youth D, and
Youth E on outings either together or individually. Staff 6 reported
sometimes the outings Staff 1 would take youth on would be 8-9
hours long. Staff 6 reported these instances would make staff and
youth upset because Staff 1 would use a facility vehicle, which
meant due to ratio and/or lack of vehicles, other youth were not
able to go on outings. Staff 6 reported she never spoke with
management about her concerns regarding outings. Staff 6
reported she did not personally witness Staff 1 having any
inappropriate interactions with any youth.
Staff 7 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/18/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 7 reported she isn’t
6

aware of any staff having inappropriate relationships with youth
currently or in the past. Staff 7 reported when Staff 1 worked at
the facility, she was closest with Youth A, Youth D, and Youth E
and would frequently take them on outings. Staff 7 reported she
doesn’t know anything about Staff 1 being in a relationship with
any youth. Staff 7 reported she previously informed Chief
Administrator about concerns regarding Staff 1 having boundary
issues with youth (i.e. sleeping on the job, sharing information
from staff meetings with the youth, sharing a blanket with a youth
while watching a movie on the couch), and those were addressed.
Staff 7 reported she never saw Staff 1 have any inappropriate
interactions with Youth A.
Staff 8 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/18/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 8 reported she
hasn’t heard of or seen any staff and youth engaging in
inappropriate interactions or relationships currently or in the past.
Staff 8 reported if she ever learned of anything like that, she would
have immediately informed her supervisor. Staff 8 reported Staff 1
would take youth on outings and to church. Staff 8 reported
typically Staff 1 was responsible for taking youth on outings
because she worked on the weekends, and other staff were too
new. Staff 8 reported Youth A was never inappropriate with any
staff.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
12/18/24 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 1
reported he started working at Casa Del Sol at the beginning of
May 2024, and Youth A was only at the facility for a few weeks
before he moved out. Supervisor 1 reported he was not aware of
any inappropriate relationships between staff and youth.
Supervisor 1 reported he never received any reports about
inappropriate interactions between Youth A and Staff 1.
Supervisor 1 reported one time Staff 11 shared a concern Staff 1
was gone all day with a youth (couldn’t remember who) in a facility
vehicle, came back to the facility, and left again with the same
youth in her personal vehicle. Supervisor 1 reported he spoke with
Staff 1 and informed her no one-to-one outings with youth are to
occur without supervisor permission, and talked to her about the
negative effects long outings could have on youth to staff ratio.
Supervisor 1 informed Staff 1 leaving with 1-2 youth for extended
periods of time is counterproductive to the program, reviewed the
ratio and supervision policies with her in detail, and provided her
with copies of the policies. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 stated
she was unaware of the requirements and said it wouldn’t happen
again. Supervisor 1 reported he could not remember if he spoke
7

with her about using her personal vehicle to transport youth.
Supervisor 1 reported no other staff ever brought up concerns to
him about Staff 1.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 12/18/24, and via phone on 1/7/25 in coordination
with MDHHS Worker. CA reported YAVFC Director was notified
Youth A was in a relationship with Staff 1 during a MDHHS
investigation that occurred in October 2024. CA reported YAVFC
Director recently reported she was informed Staff 1 might be
pregnant with Youth A’s baby. CA reported she was not aware of
any inappropriate interactions or relationship between Youth A
and Staff 1 while Youth A was at the facility and Staff 1 worked
there, so she was surprised when these allegations came out. CA
reported when Casa Del Sol was operating out of CCI Bridgeway,
she was informed by Staff 7 that Staff 1 shared a blanket with
Youth D in the milieu while they were watching a movie. CA
reported she met with Staff 1 and discussed concerns about
professional boundaries between youth and staff. CA reported she
met with her for more frequent supervision meetings after to
continue to reinforce the need for boundaries and ensure Staff 1’s
understanding. CA reported youth typically go on outings during
the weekends, and the shift lead assigns a staff to do the outings.
CA reported she was not aware of concerns regarding Staff 1
taking youth out on individual or group outings for long or
excessive periods of time. CA reported the last all day outing she
remembered was a soccer tournament, but there would have
been more than one staff assigned to go. CA reported around May
2024, Staff 1 asked Supervisor 1 if she could have four months off
work because she wanted to spend time with her son while school
was out for the summer. CA reported Staff 1’s request was
denied, and she was told she would have to quit employment and
return later. CA reported shortly after, Staff 1 submitted her
resignation letter.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Email from CA to Staff 1 dated 10/17/23 recapping a
meeting CA held with Staff 1 on 10/13/23 to talk about
boundaries with youth and staff expectations. CA assigned
Staff 1 three trainings to complete on Cornerstone. CA
noted the schedule of her biweekly supervision meetings
with Staff 1 moving forward.
• Staff Conduct and Expectations policy states staff shall
maintain appropriate boundaries with youth which includes
(but not limited to) not having contact with youth outside of
job responsibilities.
8

• Reviewed discharged youth list from Interim Inspection
2024 which notes Youth A was placed at the facility from
3/19/24-5/22/24.
• Staff Code of Conduct policy states staff will not engage in
any form of sexual abuse, sexual harassment, or
inappropriate sexual behavior. Staff may not have contact
with any youth outside of the facility beyond that necessary
to carry out job duties while the youth is in care. Staff must
confine their interactions and/or relationships with youth to
activities falling within the scope of the staff’s job duties.
Staff may not live with or engage in any relationship with
youth, including romantic or sexual, while the youth is at the
facility, nor at any point following the youth’s discharge until
the youth turns 21 years old.
o Staff Code of Conduct policy was signed by Staff 1
on 2/17/23 & 10/13/23.
• Procedure Manual for Preventing Sexual Abuse in
Unaccompanied Children Programs states there is a “Zero
Tolerance” policy which means all suspicions or
accusations of sexual abuse, sexual harassment, or
inappropriate sexual behavior must be acted upon swiftly
and seriously by following the facility’s plan. Staff are
prohibited from doing the following with youth in care or
within three years after the youth’s discharge from the
program: Staff may not have contact with youth outside of
the program besides what is necessary to carry out job
duties, staff may not engage in a romantic or sexual
relationship with youth, and staff may not live with a youth.
• Acknowledgement of Preventing Sexual Abuse (PSA)
manual receipt confirms staff committed to following the
standards listed in the manual and committed to informing
their supervisor if there is anything in the manual, they feel
they cannot comply with or have questions about.
o Staff 1 signed acknowledgement on 3/11/22,
11/11/22, 2/17/23 & 2/16/24
• Staff 1’s employee file contains a resignation letter stating
she resigned on 6/9/24 due to personal reasons. Staff 1 did
not have any disciplinary actions in her employee file. Staff
1 completed Code of Conduct training (10/19/23), BCS
Zero Tolerance training (3/11/22, 5/27/22, 8/5/22, 1/6/23,
3/25/23, 7/28/23, 10/19/23 & 3/10/24), BCS Therapeutic
Boundaries training (8/5/22, 1/6/23, 2/10/23 & 10/19/23),
9

and BCS UC Maintaining Professional Boundaries training
(10/19/23).
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews conducted
and documentation reviewed, Youth A and Staff 1 are in a
relationship, but the relationship did not begin until after Youth A
turned 18, he was no longer a youth at the facility, and Staff 1 was
no longer a staff at the facility. There is no information to support
Staff 1 acted inappropriately towards Youth A while she was
working at the facility and Youth A lived at the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 violated facility policies regarding providing personal
contact information to youth, and supervising youth on outings.
Staff 2, Staff 3 and Staff 6 violated policies regarding reporting
requirements of sexual harassment to a youth by a staff.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at a community library on
12/18/24 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported
she had all the youths’ cell phone numbers in her personal phone
when she worked at the facility, and she provided all the youth
with her personal number as well. Staff 1 reported she had to
exchange contact information with them because if she would take
youth on outings, she would sometimes drop youth off at the
outing and come pick them up later and would need a way to
communicate with them. Staff 1 reported they weren’t provided
with a work cell phone. Staff 1 reported this contact exchange is
why Youth A had her phone number and was able to contact her
in July 2024.
Staff 4, Staff 5, Staff 7, Staff 8, and Supervisor 1 were
interviewed face to face separately at the facility on 12/18/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. They all reported staff are
not to provide their personal phone numbers to any youth. They all
reported the youth are all provided with the facility phone number
and are instructed to call that number if they need anything. They
all reported staff are to maintain line of sight supervision for youth
10

during outings, and they are not allowed to leave youth alone or
drop them off and pick them up later.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/18/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported staff are
not to provide their personal phone numbers to any youth. Staff 2
reported youth are provided with the facility phone number and
are instructed to call that number if they need anything. Staff 2
reported staff are to maintain line of sight supervision for youth on
outings and are not allowed to leave youth alone or drop them off
and pick them up later. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 told him Youth D
had either shown Staff 3 or Staff 3 saw Youth D scrolling through
pictures, and Staff 3 saw a picture of Staff 1 laying on a bed
showing her bare butt. Staff 2 reported he did not see the picture,
and Staff 3 told him Chief Administrator was informed about the
incident. Staff 2 reported he did not speak to Chief Administrator
about the concern or complete any reports regarding the concern.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/18/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported staff are
not to provide their personal phone numbers to any youth. Staff 3
reported youth are provided with the facility phone number and
are instructed to call that number if they need anything. Staff 3
reported staff are to maintain line of sight supervision for youth on
outings and are not allowed to leave youth alone or drop them off
and pick them up later. Staff 3 reported at the end of December
2023, he was on an outing with Youth D, and Youth D said, “[Staff
1] got a Brazilian butt lift”. Staff 3 reported he thought Youth D was
joking, but then Youth D showed Staff 3 pictures of Staff 1. Staff 3
reported the first picture was of Staff 1 with her shirt up, showing
the bare skin of her stomach and hips. Staff 3 reported the second
picture was a selfie of Staff 1 clothed, laying on a bed showing her
back and butt. Staff 3 reported he asked Youth D how he obtained
the pictures and Youth D stated Staff 1 sent them to him. Staff 3
reported on 1/1/24, he sent a text to Chief Administrator
requesting a time to talk to her about a concern he had with a
staff. Staff 3 reported he met with Chief Administrator shortly after
and told her about the incident.
Staff 6 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/18/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 6 reported staff are
not to provide their personal phone numbers to any youth. Staff 6
reported youth are provided with the facility phone number and
are instructed to call that number if they need anything. Staff 6
reported staff are to maintain line of sight supervision for youth on
outings and are not allowed to leave youth alone or drop them off
11

and pick them up later. Staff 6 reported Staff 3 told her Staff 1 sent
inappropriate pictures to Youth D. Staff 6 reported Staff 3 told her
the pictures were of Staff 1’s body, but Staff 6 reported she wasn’t
aware if Staff 1 was clothed or naked because she didn’t see the
pictures. Staff 6 reported she thinks Staff 3 met with Chief
Administrator about the concern, but she wasn’t sure. Staff 6
reported she never spoke with management or completed
mandated reporting procedures about her concerns regarding
Staff 1 possibly sending pictures to Youth D.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 12/18/24 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. CA
reported no youth should have staff’s personal phone numbers.
CA reported there is a staff cell phone kept at the facility for youth
to call and request to be picked up, inform staff if they’re staying
late at school, etc. so there’s no reason for youth to have staff’s
personal phone numbers. CA reported she was not aware Staff 1
provided her phone number to any youth. CA reported when staff
take youth on outings, they are supposed to stay with the youth
and have them in line of sight. CA reported staff are not typically
allowed to drop youth off and pick them up later or wait in the car
while the youth are at the outing location. CA reported some youth
are approved for independent outings based on their PIE level of
independence, and those are the only youth who may be dropped
off at an outing and be picked up later. CA reported no staff,
including Staff 3, ever talked to her about Staff 1 sending an
inappropriate picture to Youth D. CA reported she met with Staff 3
at the beginning of January 2024 regarding general staff
concerns, but doesn’t recall Staff 3 telling her anything about
pictures, and her supervision notes also don’t reflect that
information. CA reported Staff 3 expressed staff were upset
because they found out Staff 1 took a month off work to have
surgery, but originally said she was taking a month off work to visit
with family.
Youth A was interviewed face to face in a community parking
lot on 12/13/24 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported he did not have Staff 1’s phone number and did not
communicate with her via text or phone while he was a youth at
the facility and while she was working at the facility.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed separately face to face
at the facility on 12/18/24 in coordination with MDHHS
Worker. Youth B and Youth C reported they were never provided
with Staff 1’s personal phone number and never had
communication with her via text or phone call. Youth B and Youth
12

C reported when Staff 1 took them on outings, she stayed with
them the entire time.
Youth D was interviewed via phone on 1/6/25 in coordination
with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported Staff 1 never provided
him with her personal phone number. Youth D reported all his
communication with Staff 1 was face to face while Staff 1 was
working, and he never communicated with her via text or phone
call while she worked at the facility. Youth D reported Staff 1 never
sent him any pictures, and he never told or showed anyone that
he received anything from her. Youth D reported he remembers
Staff 1 had surgery, but she never sent him or showed him any

Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentation reviewed, the
facility is found in non-compliance.
Staff 1 admitted to providing her personal contact information to
youth, which violates the facility’s cell phone usage policy, staff’s
personal information policy, and the staff conduct guidelines
outlined in the procedure for preventing sexual abuse manual.
Staff 1 admitted to dropping youth off at outings and picking them
up later, which is a violation of the facility’s resident offsite
supervision policy.
Staff 3 reported he viewed inappropriate pictures Staff 1 sent to
Youth D, which would have been considered sexual harassment
of a youth by a staff based on the facility’s PSA manual. Staff 2
and Staff 6 reported Staff 3 told them about Staff 1 sending Youth
D pictures. Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 6 all had knowledge,
suspicion, and/or information Staff 1 sent inappropriate pictures to
Youth D, but none of them followed the staff code of conduct
policy and the PSA manual procedure outlining the steps for
mandated reporting.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It is recommended the facility review mandated reporting
requirements with their staff as there were multiple staff who
reported they heard about Staff 1 possibly sending Youth A
inappropriate pictures, but no one properly reported the
information despite their concerns. Ensure staff know they are
obligated to make complaints directly to centralized intake, and do
not have to notify their supervisor prior to making a complaint.
Even if one staff says they’re going to make a report, every staff
who has knowledge of the information is bound by mandated
16

reporting requirements and should ensure they make their own
individual report.
Conclusion Violation Established

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
